title: "The Role of the Ego in Shaping Our Perception of Reality"
first_phrase: In this final part of the text, the author discusses the concepts of the ego and the observer in relation to our perception of reality. They argue that the ego, while important for individual survival, can be too rigid and needs to be expanded to a broader dimension. The author suggests that by amplifying both active and passive principles and increasing our sensations, we can expand our consciousness beyond the limited scope of the ego. Additionally, the author discusses the division between the observer and the observed, which can be seen as a reflection of the division between our conscious and unconscious processes. Finally, the author touches upon the idea that we are creators of our own reality.
